choices.name: Get started with research for your Delaware ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Delaware ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine priorities for Delaware research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Delaware research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Delaware Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Delaware ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Delaware Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Delaware research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Delaware Resources
    ☆ AC—Delaware State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Delaware Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Delaware Record Selection Table

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial Delaware.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Delaware


    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Delaware in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Delaware

    2. For African American research and resources, study this page:

      ☆ AG—Delaware African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Delaware.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Delaware in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Delaware


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial Delaware.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Delaware

Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Delaware in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Delaware

  2. For African American research and resources, study this page:

    ☆ AG—Delaware African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Delaware.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Delaware in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Delaware

1. Explore Delaware historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Delaware History

  2. Explore Delaware history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Delaware

  3. Learn about Delaware history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Delaware History

choices.name: Learn about Delaware archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Delaware archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Delaware Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Delaware State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Delaware.
  3. Explore the Delaware Dept of Archives site.
  4. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Delaware.
  5. Explore the Delaware Public Archives site.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Delaware genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Delaware research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Delaware ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:

  2. Sites: Explore Delaware city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

name: Search Records

Kent A L G U
New Castle A L G U
Sussex A L G U

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Delaware County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Delaware.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Delaware Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Delaware Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Delaware Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Delaware.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Delaware research.
  2. Explore the Delaware research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Delaware research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Delaware in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Delaware Societies

  2. Explore the Delaware Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore Delaware genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Delaware.
